main_definition: Sage refers to a person who has profound wisdom, knowledge, or experience; it can also describe the herb known as 'Salvia officinalis', commonly used in cooking and traditional medicine.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An elderly man of wisdom, often seen as a trusted advisor or teacher
meanings_and_examples.example: The sage council provided guidance to the community during difficult times.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A type of perennial herb with culinary and medicinal uses
meanings_and_examples.example: I used fresh sage leaves in my roast turkey recipe for added flavor.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An astute person, often wise beyond their years or age
meanings_and_examples.example: The young girl was considered quite the sage when it came to solving problems among her friends.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group of people who are highly respected for their wisdom and knowledge in a particular area
meanings_and_examples.example: The Royal Society is an assembly of scientists, thinkers, and philosophers referred to as the sages of our age.
